trans-unit.source: By default, the <ph conref="../conrefs.dita#prod/productshortname"></ph> Network Server listens only on the localhost. Clients must use the localhost host name to connect.

seg-source.mrk: By default, the <ph conref="../conrefs.dita#prod/productshortname"></ph> Network Server listens only on the localhost.
Clients must use the localhost host name to connect.

target.mrk: By default, the <ph conref="../conrefs.dita#prod/productshortname"></ph> Network Server listens only on the localhost.
Clients must use the localhost host name to connect.

trans-unit.source: By default, clients cannot access the Network Server from another host. To enable connections from other hosts, set the <codeph>derby.drda.host</codeph> property, or start the Network Server with the <codeph>-h</codeph> option in the <codeph>java org.apache.derby.drda.NetworkServerControl start</codeph> command.

seg-source.mrk: By default, clients cannot access the Network Server from another host.

To enable connections from other hosts, set the <codeph>derby.drda.host</codeph> property, or start the Network Server with the <codeph>-h</codeph> option in the <codeph>java org.apache.derby.drda.NetworkServerControl start</codeph> command.

target.mrk: By default, clients cannot access the Network Server from another host.

To enable connections from other hosts, set the <codeph>derby.drda.host</codeph> property, or start the Network Server with the <codeph>-h</codeph> option in the <codeph>java org.apache.derby.drda.NetworkServerControl start</codeph> command.

trans-unit.source: In the following example, the server will listen only on the localhost, and clients cannot access the server from another host:

seg-source.mrk: In the following example, the server will listen only on the localhost, and clients cannot access the server from another host:

target.mrk: In the following example, the server will listen only on the localhost, and clients cannot access the server from another host:

trans-unit.source: In the following example, the server runs on the host machine <codeph>sampleserver.example.com</codeph> and also listens for clients from other hosts. Clients must specify the server in the URL or DataSource as <codeph>sampleserver.example.com</codeph>:

seg-source.mrk: In the following example, the server runs on the host machine <codeph>sampleserver.example.com</codeph> and also listens for clients from other hosts.
Clients must specify the server in the URL or DataSource as <codeph>sampleserver.example.com</codeph>:

target.mrk: In the following example, the server runs on the host machine <codeph>sampleserver.example.com</codeph> and also listens for clients from other hosts.
Clients must specify the server in the URL or DataSource as <codeph>sampleserver.example.com</codeph>:

trans-unit.source: To start the Network Server so that it will listen on all interfaces, start with an IP address of <codeph>0.0.0.0</codeph>, as shown in the following example:

seg-source.mrk: To start the Network Server so that it will listen on all interfaces, start with an IP address of <codeph>0.0.0.0</codeph>, as shown in the following example:

target.mrk: To start the Network Server so that it will listen on all interfaces, start with an IP address of <codeph>0.0.0.0</codeph>, as shown in the following example:

trans-unit.source: A server that is started with the <codeph>-h 0.0.0.0</codeph> option will listen to client requests that originate from both <codeph>localhost</codeph> and from other machines on the network.

seg-source.mrk: A server that is started with the <codeph>-h 0.0.0.0</codeph> option will listen to client requests that originate from both <codeph>localhost</codeph> and from other machines on the network.

target.mrk: A server that is started with the <codeph>-h 0.0.0.0</codeph> option will listen to client requests that originate from both <codeph>localhost</codeph> and from other machines on the network.

trans-unit.source: However, administrative commands (for example, <codeph>org.apache.derby.drda.NetworkServerControl shutdown</codeph>) can run only on the host where the server was started, even if the server was started with the <codeph>-h</codeph> option.

seg-source.mrk: However, administrative commands (for example, <codeph>org.apache.derby.drda.NetworkServerControl shutdown</codeph>) can run only on the host where the server was started, even if the server was started with the <codeph>-h</codeph> option.

target.mrk: However, administrative commands (for example, <codeph>org.apache.derby.drda.NetworkServerControl shutdown</codeph>) can run only on the host where the server was started, even if the server was started with the <codeph>-h</codeph> option.
